Introduction  
Mobile p hone numbers serve  as the ultimate user identity in the digital  universe. Digital applications,  
whether on the web  or on mobile verify the mobile numbers of their users to ensure their authenticity. 
To address this growing need, U2opia has developed a reliable, quick,  and cost -effective mobile number 
verification service called Verify Now  
Help and S upport  
For implementation support and any feedback, please reach out to  us at 
operations@messagecentral.com  
API Request and Response  
The API will only accept requests fro m the service provider via the API Endpoint URI shared with the 
service provider and from whitelisted IP addresses over HTTP, partner to provide a list of source IP.  
REST API Base URL’s:  
All Platform API endpoints below should be prefixed with the following URL:  
https://cpaas .messagecentral.com  
 
Generate  Token  
To generate Auth Token for send otp & valida te otp header.  For now, the Auth Token automatically 
expires in 30 minutes.  
 
Field  Type  Mandatory  Description  
customerId  String  yes Customer identifier  
country  Integer  no Country  
Email  String  no Email  
key String  yes Base -64 encrypted password  
scope  String  no Use ‘NEW’

Send O TP 
To send OTP  on a mobile number below are the request parameters.  
 
Request Header  Type  Mandatory  
authToken  String  yes 
 
Field  Type  Mandatory  Description  
customerId  String  yes Customer identifier  
countryCode  String  yes Country code  
otpLength  Integer  no Send a number between 4 and 8. Default is 
4 
mobileNumber  String  yes Mobile number  
flowType  String  yes We send OTP using multiple mediums  like 
SMS , email , etc. 
for now , use SMS only  
email  String  no Email is used when we send OTP through 
mail  
langId  String  no For sending SMS in different languages.  
By default language is English.  
For now,  we support English -only

API Request:
A typical API request for Message Central might include the following parameters:
Endpoint: The specific URL where the API is accessed, such as 'https://api.messagecentral.com/send-sms'.
Headers: Authentication and other necessary headers like Content-Type.
Body: The payload containing the message content, recipient number, and other relevant details.

API Response:
Upon receiving a request, the API will send back a response. The response will typically include:
Status Code: A numeric value indicating the success or failure of the request, such as 200 for success or 4xx/5xx for errors.
Headers: Additional information related to the response, such as Content-Type.
Body: The actual response data, which could be a success message, error details, or any other relevant information.

For a more detailed understanding of the API request and response structure for Message Central, it's advisable to refer to the official API documentation provided by the platform. 🌐📊 #MessageCentral
